intro: Gnaphalium rompelii, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical shapes. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine regions. Gnaphalium rompelii is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
